video_prompt: Transition from fully husked to partially husked ear of corn revealing vibrant yellow kernels. Corn silk gently sways. Husks gracefully unfurl and settle. Reflection on the surface subtly appears and deepens. Subtle light shifts across the corn and ground.
image_prompt: Close-up, high-angle shot of a partially husked ear of vibrant yellow corn, standing upright on a shiny, light off-white surface with a faint reflection. Light green husks are peeled back to reveal two-thirds of the cob, showcasing plump, aligned kernels with a gradient from pale to rich yellow. Golden-brown corn silk crowns the top. Well-lit, emphasizing texture, with soft shadows. Fresh, simple, natural beauty.
refined_video_prompt: Husks progressively unfurl and peel back, exposing the vibrant yellow kernels. Corn silk gently sways as the husks settle. A subtle reflection emerges on the corn's surface, then deepens. Light dynamically shifts, altering highlights and shadows across the corn and ground.
